items.question: Which of the following best describes behaviorism?

You are convinced that whenever a student performs a desired behavior, provide reinforcement and soon the student learns to perform the behavior on her own. On which principle is your conviction based?
The reinforcement of a person's responses by presentation or removal of rewards and punishment.
Which type of learning takes place when an originally neutral stimulus comes to elicit a response that was originally given to another stimulus?
The application of behavioral principles to change an individual's behavior is called
Psychologists refer to classical conditioning as the process

choices.text: Systematically rewarding small sub-steps that are part of a more complex, multi-step behavior until the complex behavior is learned
By which a new stimulus elicits a response formerly elicited by another stimulus
In which a response is followed by a stimulus that leads to an increase or decrease in the frequency of the response
Producing identical responses similar to stimuli

items.question: Psychologists refer to operant conditioning as the process

choices.text: Systematically rewarding small sub-steps that are part of a more complex, multi-step behavior until the complex behavior is learned
By which a new stimulus elicits a response formerly elicited by another stimulus
In which a response is followed by a stimulus that leads to an increase or decrease in the frequency of the response
Producing identical responses similar to stimuli

items.question: A person who has had painful experiences at the dentist's office may become fearful at the mere sight of the dentist's office. Which theory can explain this?

In a treatment for alcoholism, Ramil was made to drink an alcoholic beverage then made to ingest a drug that produces nausea. Eventually, he was nauseated at the sight and smell of alcohol and stopped drinking alcohol. Which theory explains this?
When does punishment facilitate learning?

choices.text: When punishment ensures emotional reaction on the learner
When punishment follows the error immediately
When punishment is severe and is linked to the deed
When punishment has been effective in the past

items.question: Following the behaviorist theory of learning, which situation shows that learning has occured?

choices.text: When a pupil can write his name in class, a behavior he can also do at home
When a pupil can write his name, an act he couldn't do before
When the pupil learns to write his name in class
When the pupil can read and write his name simultaneously

items.question: When should reinforcement be used by a teacher to be effective?

choices.text: When applied to either good or bad behavior

items.question: Operant conditioning increases the likelihood of a response by following the behavior with a
A teacher who gives students 15 minutes of class time to spend on activities they enjoy for every hour they spend engaging in on-task behavior is using
A teacher who reduces by 5 minutes the amount of class time students can spend on activities they enjoy each time they engaged in disruptive behavior is using
A teacher who attempts to reduce the frequency of disruptive behavior in the classroom by ignoring the students when they engage in disruptive behavior is using
A teacher who reduces by 10 minutes the amount of time students must spend in detention for every hour they spend engaging in on-task behavior is using
Which is the consensus of psychologists about the emphasis of external rewards and punishment in the classroom?

choices.text: It tends to overwork the law of effect so that it becomes ineffective
The pupils soon learn to work for the incentives rather than for the desirable learning
Its emphasis leads to effective learning
It will soon lead to excessive use of rewards and punishment

items.question: Which is a classroom application of the theory of operant conditioning?

choices.text: Reinforce a good behavior to increase the likelihood that the learner will repeat the response
Create a classroom atmosphere that elicits relaxation
Helps students see the connectedness of facts, concepts and principles
Make students learn by operating manipulatives

items.question: Watson applied classical conditioning in his experiments and the result showed that behavior is learned through stimulus-response associations, specifically the development of emotional responses to certain stimuli. This helps us in ____

choices.text: Understanding the role of overt behavior

items.question: This cognitive learning theory emphasizes the need for students to be given opportunities to find relationship among concepts or search for solutions to a problem on their own. What theory is this?
In contrast to behaviorists' approach to learning, cognitivists emphasizes the important role of

According to cognitive psychologists, presenting new concepts to students should be done as a sequence. Which of the following responses represents the correct order for presenting new concepts?
       I.   A prototype example
      II.   A non-example
     III.  The less obvious example
     IV.  The name and definition of the concept
      V.  Relevant and irrelevant attribute
Transfer of learning easily takes place if the activities involved
Learning has taken place when a strong bond between stimulus and response is formed. This is based on the theory of ____
A six-year-old child who has a mental age of eight years has an IQ of
The ration obtained by dividing mental age by chronological age times 100 is called
What process involves the storing, preserving, and retrieving of learning accurately when a need tor such arises?
One of the following is an effective means of ensuring transfer of learning

choices.text: Use of pictures and different aids
Use of true to life, in and out of school situations

items.question: In a rehearsal process, the individual

choices.text: Actively process information that is currently in the short-term memory
Tries to retrieve information from long-term memory
Retains information for up to approximately 20 to 30 seconds

items.question: Increasing short term memory duration and capacity would involve
Which one does NOT directly affect retention of learning?
Which of the following is true about attention?

choices.text: Humans can attend to unlimited number of incoming stimuli
Humans can attend to seven plus or minus two incoming stimuli
Humans can attend to two different stimuli simultaneously
Humans can attend to only one stimulus at a time

items.question: Which of the following statements concerning long-term memory is false?

choices.text: Retrieval from it depends on organization
Information enters it without any effort of intention
Information can be stored in it for a lifetime

items.question: One important distinction of memory concerns the three stages of memory. These stages are
It is sound to encourage students to define terms in their own words because _____

choices.text: Defining terms in their own words helps them memorize the definition faster
Students remember information better when they mentally process it in some way
This is one opportunity to brush up with their English
They ought to connect the terms that they learn with other terms

items.question: Who first formalized and explored systematically the observational learning theory?

Guia and Bea often see their teacher brush her teeth, fix her hair, and powder her face after lunch. After some time, the two girls were observed doing the same things, what theory of learning is involved in this situation?
Social learning involves four processes. One of these is done by acting out the behavior learned from other people. Which is this?
Ms. Aleta an English teacher pointed out to the students the specific elements in amking well-written paragraphs. What element of observational learning is demonstrated?
Which is an underlying assumption of the social cognitive theory? People _____

Based on Bandura's theory, which conditions must be present for a student to learn from a
model?
       I.     Attention
      II.     Retention
     III.     Motor Reproduction
     IV.     Motivation
Teacher Stef, a science teacher, makes sure all eyes are on her as she demonstrates the proper way to light the Bunsen Burner. Whose theory supports Teacher Stef's practice?
Which BEST describes the attitudes and personal views that people hold and which greatly influence their behavior?

choices.text: Attitudes are formed primarily through maturation
They are learned through observation, imitation, and development of moral concepts
They are best developed through discussions of social and moral theories
They can best be imbibed through a study of the country's heroes

items.question: Every time Ms. Bautista presents a new unit, she does so with the use of an advance organizer. Which principle does she apply?

choices.text: Provide the correct response on the first trial
Arrange materials into appropriate learning units
Assists students to identify meaningful relationships

items.question: Which of the following best describes what meaningful learning is?

choices.text: When what is to be learned is new and easy for the students
Materials presented are difficult and challenging to the students
When the materials to be learned are related to what the students already know
Students find the lessons easy and relevant to what was assigned to them

items.question: Teacher Z always checks on entry knowledge and skills before she proceeds to her new lesson. On which principle is teacher Z's practice grounded?

choices.text: Effective teaching from the concrete to the abstract
Learning increases when the lesson is relevant
New learning builds on previous learning

items.question: According to Ausubel, one of the ways to strengthen the students' cognitive structure is by using an instructional tool called _____
According to Gagne. educational programs have the ultimate purpose of teaching students to ____
According to Robert Gagne, all types of learning outcomes can be categorized into which of the following taxonomies?

choices.text: Verbal informational, intellectual skills, cognitive strategies, motor skills and attitudes
Knowledge, comprehension, application, analysis, synthesis evalutation

items.question: Which of the theories of learning presents or states that learning skills are hierarchically arranged?
What does Gagne's hierarchical theory propose for effective instruction?

choices.text: Be concerned with the socio-emotional climate in the classroom

items.question: Who proposed the concept that all possess several intelligences but varying degrees of strength and skill?
Which behavior is exhibited by a student who is string in interpersonal intelligence?

choices.text: Seeks out a classmate for help when problem occurs

items.question: Which learning principle marks the highlight of Multiple Intelligence?

choices.text: Intelligence is not measured in one form
Cognitive theory is stressed in learning

items.question: Identify the ninth intelligence which is described as the ability to seek connection involving one's place in the family, school, community, and "role in the world". They seek "why are we here?" This intelligence is termed _____
Which can enhance the development of visual intelligence?
Which of these activities is NOT appealing to the bodily-kinesthetic learners?
Which of the following basis for learning is related to the individual's desire and interest to learn?
Increased student interest and motivation can be provided by ____

choices.text: Making students active partners in the teaching/learning acts
Asking students to help set realistic goals and providing information to both teacher and students to see if the goals are achieved
Showing students that they  have progressed to give them satisfaction and desire to continue to learn

items.question: The following EXCEPT ONE are important considerations for learners to be motivated to learn. Which is the exception?

choices.text: If learnings are beyond their ability levels
If they are given regular, positive reinforcement

items.question: Which exemplifies intrinsic motivation? "I want to learn to perform mathematical operations fast..."

choices.text: So I will get higher grades in Math
So I will win the Quiz Bee Contest
So I can solve more difficult mathematical problems
So Dad can give me the watch he promised

items.question: When does an individual learn more readily?

choices.text: When under the control of school standard

items.question: Which educational issue can be clarified by understanding Maslow's Needs Theory?

choices.text: The effects of different classroom structures
The effects of poverty on academic achievement

items.question: If a teacher accepts Maslow's theory on the hierarchy of needs, he or she will probably structure objectives to:

choices.text: meet both the physiological and intellectual needs of students
maintain a certain anxiety level for increased competition

items.question: Which of the following theories led its proponent, Wolfgang Kohler, based on is studies on apes, to conclude that learning was a result of insightful solution bot blind trial and error?

After reading and paraphrasing Robert Frost's Stopping by the Woods on a Snowy Evening, Mr. Marquez asks the class to share insight derived from the poem (Answer #67-68)

On which assumption about the learner is Mr. Marquez's act of asking the class to share their insight based?

choices.text: Learners are producers of knowledge not only passive recipients of information
Learners are meant to interact with one another
Learners are like empty receptacles waiting to be filled up
Learners have multiple intelligences and varied learning styles

items.question: The class was asked to share their insights about the poem. The ability to come up with an insight stems from the ability to ____

choices.text: Comprehend the subject that is being studied
Analyze the parts of the whole
Evaluate the worthiness of a thing
Relate and organize things and ideas

items.question: Which psychological theory states that the mind insists on finding patterns in things that contribute to the development of insight?
What is more likely to happen if teachers foster conformity?

choices.text: Full development of each individual personality is prevented

items.question: Which of the following statements will not support the concept of individual differences?

choices.text: Use varied activities for a difficult lesson
Consider the uniqueness of each student
Involve all students regardless of what the activity is
Help should be extended to both gifted and retarded

items.question: An effective way for teachers to deal with student's individual differences is to use

choices.text: The principles of shaping and extinction

items.question: Teacher Vicky asked her pupils to check their own drawn map using geography book; that gives children experience in
Which of the following principles of learning applies considering students' age and in presenting certain content and cognitive processes?

choices.text: Principles of learning aided by formulating and asking question

items.question: Which statement best explains the Law of Effect?

choices.text: Learning involves repetition of learned activity
The law effect is best applied in Math learning
Learning is affected by the satisfaction it provides
The law of effect implies automatic response learning

items.question: Jordan loves to read. To encourage him to do Math, his teacher rewards him with fifteen minute free reading time for every thirty minutes he works on his math. Which type of reward does the teacher's strategy represent?

Guadalupe loves o do Math, but hates reading. To encourage her to spend time reading, her teacher introduces books on topics she thinks Guadalupe will enjoy. She starts by gicing her a book about a girl who loves to do Math. What type of reward does the teacher's strategy represent?
A basic premise of attribution theory is that human motivation is a product of

choices.text: Two competing needs: the need to achieve success and the need to avoid failure
Our belief about the cause of our successes and failures
A hierarchical organization of needs from basic to higher needs
Our belief that we can produce behavior that lead to specific outcomes

items.question: Maribel doesn't enjoy writing but can't escape from it. She has to finish it in order to graduate. Mara has always liked to write. She really likes to become a better writer because she wants to be a journalist someday. Who is likely to be more focused on the writing activity and why?

choices.text: Mara, because she is intrinsically motivated.
Maribel, because she is extrinsically motivated.
Both, because they are both motivated anyway.
It cannot be determined. Motivation fluctuates.

items.question: The following are ways by which activities may be learned. One of these should not be included. Which one is this?

What is more likely to happen when a student gets intrinsically motivated?
       I.     Tackles assigned task willingly
      II.     Eager to learn classroom material
     III.     Engaged in meaningful learning

Which apply / applies to extrinsically motivated learners?
       I.     Tend to process information superficially
      II.     Tend to be content with meeting minimum requirements
     III.     Achieve at high level

Asked to do a learning task, Gino hesitates and says, "Mahirap ayaw ko. Di ko kaya!"
Which statement about Gino is correct?

choices.text: Gino has a low sense of self-efficacy
Gino has a high sense of self-efficacy
Gino has no sense of self-efficacy
Gino wants to be sure of his self-efficacy

items.question:
To which factor can you attribute Gino's perceived inability to perform the task? To a factor ____
       I.     Within him
      II.     Outside his control
     III.     Which is stable
     IV.     Within his control

To which problem does the case of the student allude?
       I.     Unmotivated students
      II.     Incompetent teachers
     III.     Extremely difficult learning tasks
     IV.     Uncaring teachers
